slides.title: The Art of Debate
slides.text: Great minds discuss ideas. Average minds discuss events. Small minds discuss people.
slides.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

slides.title: Needed To Be Said
slides.text: Design is not just what it looks like and feels like. Design is how it works.
slides.author: Steve Jobs

slides.title: Stay Hungry, Stay Foolish.
slides.text: You can't connect the dots looking forward; you can only connect them looking backwards. So you have to trust that the dots will somehow connect in your future.
slides.author: Steve Jobs

slides.title: Serve & Service
slides.text: The factory cannot look only at the profit index. It must distribute wealth, culture, services, and democracy. I think the factory for man.
slides.author: Adriano Olivetti

slides.title: No Bullshit
slides.text: Authenticity is what inspires people. If you want to lead people, you have to show them who you really are. Otherwise, you’re just a thousand-dollar suit with nothing inside.
slides.author: Cameron Howe

slides.title: Culture Matters
slides.text: I believe it is a big mistake to think that money is the only way to compensate a person for his work. People need money, but they also want to be happy in their work and proud of it.
slides.author: Akio Morita

slides.title: Legacy
slides.text: I want to build something that makes people fall in love.
slides.author: Cameron Howe

slides.title: Avoid Doomscrolling
slides.text: Attention is the rarest and purest form of generosity.
slides.author: Simone Weil

slides.title: Humanism
slides.text: I want my Olivetti to be not just a factory but a model, a lifestyle. I want it to produce freedom and beauty because those things, freedom and beauty, will tell us how to be happy.
slides.author: Adriano Olivetti

slides.title: Meaning Of Life
slides.text: Computers aren’t the thing. They’re the thing that gets us to the thing.
slides.author: Joe MacMillan

slides.title: Commerce is a Civilizing Force
slides.text: Early to bed, early to rise, work like hell and advertise.
slides.author: Ted Turner

slides.title: The Bright Side Of Life
slides.text: True definition of science: the study of the beauty of the world.
slides.author: Simone Weil

slides.title: Duties
slides.text: The notion of obligations comes before that of rights, which is subordinate and relative to the former. A right is not effectual by itself, but only in relation to the obligation to which it corresponds.
slides.author: Simone Weil

slides.title: Humans
slides.text: I realized that we create stories by imposing narrative on the events that happen around us.
slides.author: Nora Ephron

slides.title: Braun Design
slides.text: Good design is as little as possible. Less, but better, because it concentrates on the essential aspects, and the products are not burdened with non-essentials. Back to purity, back to simplicity.
slides.author: Dieter Rams

slides.title: Matterialism
slides.text: Progress is not only material growth, but civil and spiritual elevation.
slides.author: Adriano Olivetti

slides.title: Reading is sexy
slides.text: Reading is everything. Reading makes me feel like I've accomplished something, learned something, become a better person.
slides.author: Nora Ephron

slides.title: Inventing the Future
slides.text: Our plan is to lead the public with new products rather than ask them what kind of products they want.
slides.author: Akio Morita

slides.title: How To Win
slides.text: There are three creativities: creativity in technology, in product planning, and in marketing. To have any one of these without the others is self defeating in business.
slides.author: Akio Morita

slides.title: Made in Japan
slides.text: If we face recession, we should not lay off employees; the company should sacrifice a profit. It's management's risk and management's responsibility. Employees are not guilty; why should they suffer?
slides.author: Akio Morita

slides.title: Build
slides.text: Everything around you that you call life was made up by people that were no smarter than you.
slides.author: Steve Jobs

slides.title: Made in Germany
slides.text: First and foremost, Braun's special design method is based on constant and close cooperation between product designers and engineers, between communication and marketing, and above all between product design and communication.
slides.author: Fritz Eichler

slides.title: Form Follows Function
slides.text: Design should not dominate things, should not dominate people. It should help people. That is its role.
slides.author: Dieter Rams

slides.title: Good Design
slides.text: Good design is innovative. Good design must be useful. Good design is aesthetic design. Good design makes a product understandable. Good design is honest. Good design is unobtrusive. Good design is durable. Good design is coherent down to the last detail. Good design is environmentally friendly. And last but not least, good design is as little design as possible.
slides.author: Dieter Rams

slides.title: Good Writing is Clear Thinking
slides.text: Starting a company? Have a decent funding? Hire an in-house anthropologist and writer before engineers and visual designers. You will be far less likely to build a highly polished stupid thing no one understands or cares about.
slides.author: Erika Hall

slides.title: Creative Revolution
slides.text: Creativity is the most powerful force in business. It may well be the last unfair advantage we're legally allowed to take over our competitors.
slides.author: Bill Bernbach

slides.title: Stories › Atoms
slides.text: Storytelling reveals meaning without committing the error of defining it.
slides.author: Hannah Arendt

slides.title: Brave Mad Men
slides.text: Let us prove to the world that good taste, good art, good writing can be good selling.
slides.author: Bill Bernbach

slides.title: Lead by Example
slides.text: How we explain that when someone is cruel or acts like a bully you don’t stoop to their level. No, our moto is: when they go low, we go high.
slides.author: Michelle Obama

slides.title: Honesty
slides.text: A principle isn't a principle until it costs you something.
slides.author: Bill Bernbach

slides.title: Set The Example
slides.text: Children have never been very good at listening to their elders, but they have never failed to imitate them.
slides.author: James Baldwin

slides.title: Inequality
slides.text: Ignorance, allied with power, is the most ferocious enemy justice can have.
slides.author: James Baldwin

slides.title: Mass Culture
slides.text: Tell me what you pay attention to, and I will tell you who you are.
slides.author: José Ortega y Gasset

slides.title: Social Harmony
slides.text: Liberalism —it is well to recall this today— is the supreme form of generosity. It is the right which the majority concedes to minorities and hence it is the noblest cry that has ever resounded in this planet.
slides.author: José Ortega y Gasset

slides.title: The Elite
slides.text: The truly select man is not the arrogant figure who believes himself above others, but the one who holds himself to higher standards than anyone else, even if he cannot fully live up to them.
slides.author: José Ortega y Gasset

slides.title: Say No To The Fear Narratives
slides.text: A fundamental difference between modern dictatorships and all other tyrannies of the past is that terror is no longer used as a means to exterminate and frighten opponents, but as an instrument to rule masses of people who are perfectly obedient.
slides.author: Hannah Arendt

slides.title: Black Sheep
slides.text: I love America more than any other country in the world and, exactly for this reason, I insist on the right to criticize her perpetually.
slides.author: James Baldwin

slides.title: Hope as Strategy
slides.text: If we want a nation that feels hopeful, then we have to speak in hopeful terms. We have to model what we want.
slides.author: Michelle Obama

slides.title: Responsability
slides.text: All of us who professionally use the mass media are the shapers of society. We can vulgarize that society. We can brutalize it. Or we can help lift it onto a higher level.
slides.author: Bill Bernbach

slides.title: Curiosity
slides.text: You can’t just be you. You have to double yourself. You have to read books on subjects you know nothing about. You have to travel to places you never thought of traveling. You have to meet every kind of person and endlessly stretch what you know.
slides.author: Mary Wells Lawrece

slides.title: Make Me Feel
slides.text: Advertising is not a science, it is persuasion, and persuasion is an art, it is intuition that leads to discovery, to inspiration, it is the artist who is capable of making the consumer feel desire.
slides.author: Mary Wells Lawrece

slides.title: Learn To Write
slides.text: The better you write, the higher you go in Ogilvy & Mather. People who think well, write well.
slides.author: David Ogilvy

slides.title: Copywriting
slides.text: Avoid superlatives, generalizations, and platitudes. Be specific and factual. Be enthusiastic, friendly, and memorable. Don't be a bore. Tell the truth, but make the truth fascinating.
slides.author: David Ogilvy

slides.title: Committees Kill Creativity
slides.text: Much of the messy advertising you see on television today is the product of committees. Committees can criticize advertisements, but they should never be allowed to create them
slides.author: David Ogilvy

slides.title: Creative Business
slides.text: Before you can have a share of market, you must have a share of mind. Products are made in the factory, but brands are created in the mind. What helps people helps business.
slides.author: Leo Burnett

slides.title: Simplicity
slides.text: Keep it simple. Let's do the obvious thing, the common thing, but let's do it uncommonly well.
slides.author: Leo Burnett

slides.title: Shaping Culture
slides.text: Good advertising does not just circulate information. It penetrates the public mind with desires and belief.
slides.author: Leo Burnett

slides.title: The Future of Agencies
slides.text: The work of an advertising agency is warmly and immediately human. It deals with human needs, wants, dreams and hopes. Its ‘product’ cannot be turned out on an assembly line.
slides.author: Leo Burnett

slides.title: Self-confidence
slides.text: Teamwork might work in building an Amish barn, but it can’t create a big idea… Everybody believes in co-creativity—not me. Be confident of your own, edgy, solo talent.
slides.author: George Lois

slides.title: Passion
slides.text: Working hard and doing doing great work is as imperative as breathing. Creating great work warms the heart and enriches the soul. Those of us lucky enough to spend our days doing something we love, something we're good at, are rich.
slides.author: George Lois

slides.title: Happy Life
slides.text: The joy of the creative process, minute by minute, hour after hour, day by day, is the sublime path to true happiness.
slides.author: George Lois

slides.title: Clarity
slides.text: Remember: It's not how short you make it; it's how you make it short. Think long. Write short.
slides.author: George Lois

slides.title: The Mass Man
slides.text: People want to be told what to do so badly that they'll listen to anyone.
slides.author: Don Draper

slides.title: The Job
slides.text: Advertising is based on one thing: happiness. And do you know what happiness is? Happiness is the smell of a new car. It’s freedom from fear. It’s a billboard on the side of a road that screams with reassurance that whatever you’re doing is OK. You are OK.
slides.author: Don Draper

slides.title: Framing
slides.text: If you don't like what's being said, change the conversation.
slides.author: Don Draper

slides.title: Individuality
slides.text: I’m watching this new lipstick commercial. I don’t think anyone wants to be one of a hundred colors in a box.
slides.author: Peggy Olson

slides.title: Originality
slides.text: I'd never recommend imitation as a strategy. You'll be second, which is very far from first.
slides.author: Peggy Olson

slides.title: Seniority
slides.text: If you can't tell the difference between which part's the idea and which part's the execution of the idea, you're of no use to me.
slides.author: Peggy Olson

slides.title: Real Value
slides.text: Don't just start a business, build a brand.
slides.author: John Hegarty

slides.title: Creativity at its Best
slides.text: Advertising is far more than just a communications industry. It's a problem-solving industry that also teaches you about life, how it encourages you to focus your thinking and produce something of genuine value. Why? Because that will make the advertising task so much easier.
slides.author: John Hegarty

slides.title: Real Power
slides.text: Creativity can change the way we feel about something and will stay with us for eternity.
slides.author: John Hegarty

slides.title: Think for Yourself
slides.text: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to reform (or pause and reflect).
slides.author: Mark Twain

slides.title: Patriotism
slides.text: Loyalty to country ALWAYS. Loyalty to government, when it deserves it.
slides.author: Mark Twain

slides.title: Racism
slides.text: There are many humorous things in the world; among them, the white man's notion that he is less savage than the other savages.
slides.author: Mark Twain

slides.title: Loving Your Enemies
slides.text: Darkness cannot drive out darkness, only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate, only love can do that.
slides.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

slides.title: Fraternity
slides.text: I have a dream that one day this nation will rise up and live out the true meaning of its creed: We hold these truths to be self-evident, that all men are created equal.
slides.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

slides.title: Serve & Service
slides.text: Everybody can be great... because anybody can serve. You don't have to have a college degree to serve. You don't have to make your subject and verb agree to serve. You only need a heart full of grace. A soul generated by love.
slides.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

slides.title: The Ultimate Freedom
slides.text: The only way to deal with an unfree world is to become so absolutely free that your very existence is an act of rebellion.
slides.author: Albert Camus

slides.title: Responsible Absurdism
slides.text: The purpose of a writer is to keep civilization from destroying itself.
slides.author: Albert Camus

slides.title: Builder
slides.text: Well done is better than well said.
slides.author: Benjamin Franklin

slides.title: Lifestyle
slides.text: Early to bed, and early to rise, makes a man healthy, wealthy, and wise.
slides.author: Benjamin Franklin

slides.title: Wealth
slides.text: What more valuable than Gold? Diamonds. Than Diamonds? Virtue.
slides.author: Benjamin Franklin

slides.title: Education
slides.text: Educate your children to self-control, to the habit of holding passion and prejudice and evil tendencies subject to an upright and reasoning will, and you have done much to abolish misery from their future and crimes from society.
slides.author: Benjamin Franklin

slides.title: The Way to Fulfillment
slides.text: Three passions, simple but overwhelmingly strong have governed my life: the longing for love, the search for knowledge, and unbearable pity for the suffering of mankind.
slides.author: Bertrand Russell

slides.title: Light › Darkness
slides.text: Fear is the main source of superstition, and one of the main sources of cruelty. To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.
slides.author: Bertrand Russell

slides.title: Humans are rationalizing beings
slides.text: It has been said that man is a rational animal. All my life I have been searching for evidence which could support this.
slides.author: Bertrand Russell

slides.title: Elegance
slides.text: My mission in life is not merely to survive, but to thrive; and to do so with some passion, some compassion, some humor, and some style.
slides.author: Maya Angelou

slides.title: Real Growth
slides.text: Most people don't grow up. Most people age. They find parking spaces, honor their credit cards, get married, have children, and call that maturity. What that is, is aging.
slides.author: Maya Angelou

slides.title: Mental Virus
slides.text: There is nothing so pitiful as a young cynic because he has gone from knowing nothing to believing nothing.
slides.author: Maya Angelou

slides.title: Demagoguery
slides.text: Values are faithfully applied to the facts before us, while ideology overrides whatever facts call theory into question.
slides.author: Barack Obama

slides.title: Poverty
slides.text: Focusing your life solely on making a buck shows a certain poverty of ambition. It asks too little of yourself. Because it's only when you hitch your wagon to something larger than yourself that you realize your true potential.
slides.author: Barack Obama

slides.title: Unity
slides.text: There is not a liberal America and a conservative America - there is the United States of America. There is not a black America and a white America and latino America and asian America - there's the United States of America.
slides.author: Barack Obama
